verb.description: Be an expression of or give a tangible or visible form to (an idea, quality, or feeling)
examples: a team that embodies competitive spirit and skill

verb.description: Include or contain (something) as a constituent part.
examples: the changes in law embodied in the Freedom of Information Act

verb.description: Form (people) into a body, especially for military purposes.

origin: Mid 16th century: from em- + body, on the pattern of Latin incorporare.
